private_information: I observe the left peg which initially holds disks (top->bottom): A, B, C, D, E
I can report the current ordered stack of disks on my peg and which disk is on top
peg_agent_left.goal: Report the left peg state accurately to help build a global plan to move the entire tower to the right peg.

private_information: I observe the middle peg which is initially empty
I can report the current ordered stack of disks on my peg and which disk is on top
peg_agent_middle.goal: Report the middle peg state accurately to help build a global plan to move the entire tower to the right peg.

private_information: I observe the right peg which is initially empty
I can report the current ordered stack of disks on my peg and which disk is on top
peg_agent_right.goal: Report the right peg state accurately to help build a global plan to move the entire tower to the right peg.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg state reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the goal: move all disks from left to right maintaining size constraints.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi problem with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A (smallest) through E (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E.

state_report.system_prompt: You are the left-peg observer. Provide a concise machine-readable representation of the current stack on the left peg based on your private observation. Output only a list representing the peg contents from top to bottom, for example ['A','B','C']. Do not emit PDDL or planning steps; just report the peg state.

You are the middle-peg observer. Provide a concise machine-readable representation of the current stack on the middle peg based on your private observation. Output only a list representing the peg contents from top to bottom, for example []. Do not emit PDDL or planning steps; just report the peg state.

You are the right-peg observer. Provide a concise machine-readable representation of the current stack on the right peg based on your private observation. Output only a list representing the peg contents from top to bottom, for example []. Do not emit PDDL or planning steps; just report the peg state.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. You will receive three peg state reports from the agents. Using that information and the public rules of the Tower of Hanoi, produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that FastDownwards can solve. The domain must define objects, predicates, and actions to move a single disk from one peg to another while enforcing the size ordering constraint. The problem must declare objects for disks A,B,C,D,E and pegs left,middle,right, set the initial state according to the received peg state reports, and set the goal state to have all disks on the right peg in the same top-to-bottom order A,B,C,D,E. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the output is a valid PDDL encoding compatible with FastDownwards and contains no extra commentary.

orchestrator.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the peg reports and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownwards. Public information: {environment->public_information} Peg reports: left={state_left} middle={state_middle} right={state_right} Global goal: move the full stack from left to right maintaining disk ordering. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
